title: The Children
description: "Nostalgic" Jar of feathers becoming,finally, another cloistered homage to a decade of geesehaunting the grid of oursteadfastness.Un-find the covetedibis; kiss the scarlet of the robin'sblurred departure.In the end, we were landmark,compass, same as the lingered-overpond, the marshwhere cattails remained when all elseleft. Ragged in salt,cloud-headed. Paula Bohince 's poems have appeared in The New Yorker , The Nation , and Poetry . She has received fellowships from the National Endowment for the Arts, the Amy Clampitt Trust, and the Bread Loaf Writers' Conference, and an Amy Lowell Poetry Travelling Scholarship.
author: Paula Bohince
